bahalo.sampler.sample.desc: Pick color from the specified height of the beacon beam.
bahalo.ui.actbeacon: Activate beacons to unlock settings for more levels.
bahalo.ui.actplayer: Render players to unlock settings for more players.
bahalo.conf.transparency.desc: Turning it off may make it look worse, but it could improve shader compatibility. A restart might be required for it to take effect.
bahalo.conf.depthWrite.desc: Turning it off may make it look worse, but it could improve shader compatibility. A restart might be required for it to take effect.
bahalo.conf.clientCache.desc: Cache beacon positions, levels, and beam segment information locally. This allows beacons outside the view distance to be rendered. It also works in the server world. The cache will only refresh when the beacon is within view distance.
bahalo.conf.autoSide.desc: Once enabled, it is fixed as a circle, with the number of edges automatically assigned based on distance and radius. It is affected by LOD precision.
bahalo.conf.combineBeacon.desc: Multiple beacons can be combined into a single large beacon (only affects rendering). Only beacons with the same Y and the same beam structure will merge. After merging, the beacon level is the sum of the levels.ã€‚
bahalo.conf.sides.desc: Number of sides of a polygon
bahalo.conf.columnSides.desc: The higher the value, the closer the rendering is to a cylinder. However, it comes with greater overhead.
bahalo.conf.combineRadius.desc: Beacons will only trigger merging when the distance between them falls within this range.
bahalo.conf.extraFarPlane.desc: Increase the distance of the boundary fog while increasing the far plane. It has no effect on the boundary fog of shaders.
bahalo.conf.lodPrecision.desc: The higher the value, the closer it is to a circle, but the greater the cost.
